job_title: Teaching Assistant in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: The staff is very friendly and collaborative-minded.
cons: Have not encountered any major challenges working here.

review_title: IT Department worst place I've ever worked
job_title: IT Support in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: Decent pay, unions and holidays.
cons: I can't speak for other areas of the University, they could and should be amazing but Digital Services/IT is the worst place with the worst managers that I have ever worked. Horrible people, no real clue what's going on, no idea how to treat staff, not enough staff for the work required, too many managers, too siloed in different areas with no helping each other out towards a common goal, too much to list but just a nasty horrible place to work, with good holidays. No woorking from home.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: Lovely team Great opportunities Good work/life balance
cons: Difficult to find parking in city centre, public transport is unreliable in my area so commuting was sometimes an issue.

job_title: Clerical Assistant in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: Competent and friendly colleagues. Opportunities for overtime. Supportive of further education ambitions.
cons: Bureaucratic at times. Sometimes procedures unclear - which may seem at odds with other con.

job_title: Clerical Assistant in Coleraine, Northern Ireland
pros: work/home balance including flexi time
cons: It can be difficult to gain promotion

job_title: Lab Technician in Derry, Northern Ireland
pros: Colleagues are great but everything else needs improving.
cons: Management are not appropriately trained. No induction process for new staff so they rely heavily on colleagues offering help. No guidance. Roles are never properly defined, and every job is expected of you. Common to see colleagues off due to burnout. Those above keep saying things will get better but never do anything to see it through. The less you do, the more respect you get.

job_title: Graduate Student in Coleraine, Northern Ireland
pros: Great Teachers, Great facilities! Good!
cons: Students will have to think for themselves.

review_title: Would not recommend to a friend
job_title: Creative Services in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros:
- good pay
- good benefits/pension (if you could stand to stay long enough to enjoy them)
cons:
- micro-managing (to the point that it's hard to get work done)
- no recognition for a job well done
- no trust
- managers who will not advocate for you
- stressful atmosphere
- benefits used and spoken about by managers as a reason to why they can treat you poorly
- expectations beyond what is written in your contract
- revolving door of new hires (which is uncommon in public service positions)
- weaponised "personal development"

job_title: Research Associate in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: Small university so easy to reach out to network
cons: Less experience in all departments

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Coleraine, Northern Ireland
pros:
Some interesting research projects 

Gym facilities on-site with staff discount available
cons:
Managers/supervisors are not trained adequately in people management and development

Low salary compared to other similar roles

Long hours, no work life balance, expected to pick up emails and calls on evenings and weekends 

Toxic work environment

review_title: Low morale, bullying, incompetent management, no work life balance. I am so happy I escaped.
job_title: Lecturer in Jordanstown, Northern Ireland
pros: There are some truly lovely staff there. I will miss them, and I worry about their well-being.
cons:
I don't know where to start. This place left my mental health in absolute pieces. It will take me years of counseling to recover. Allegedly, the number of staff off on sick leave due to stress is just astronomical. Allegedly, the amount of long established staff jumping ship is through the roof. Allegedly, the management  could not care less about staff wellbeing, and are incapable of performing their duties. 

I literally cried with happiness because I have left that environment.

job_title: Welcome Week Team Member in Coleraine, Northern Ireland
pros:
It was short term temporary for students. 
There was manageable hours based on shifts during the welcome week period. 
There was a wage available for the position.
cons:
There was a shift scheduling issue with one of my shifts as it was actually based at another campus.
There was also one shift that I was there for that they decided to send the paid part time staff home early and kept on voluntary staff as there weren't many event attendants.

job_title: Gaphic Designer in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros: Great pay, flexible working hours when balancing full time study

job_title: Research Assistant in Belfast, Northern Ireland

job_title: Lecturer in London, England
pros:
Learn a huge amount and am able to take on responsibilities that I would not have in other institutions at my pay grade.
Good work-life balance - able to leave early if you want to.
cons:
Constantly having to adjust to new changes in the business. Very unsettling.
Very little attempt at team building.
Too unstructured - need regular meetings, updates etc.
Very poor office conditions - in a basement with little natural light.
A lot of politics within the business - very difficult to advance if you are not part of a select few.
Academic staff are treated worse than staff from other departments.
The company does not treat its customers (the students) very well.

job_title: Lecturer In Visual Communication in Derry, Northern Ireland
pros: I had a productive and enjoyable time with Ulster achieving many successes, progressing as an educator and developing significant opportunities for the creative economy in the NW of Ireland. I worked alongside a highly creative team and together we built a creative course that produced employable graduates.
cons: The University did not handle the redundancy process in a professional manner, offering little in the way of clarity and relied on opinion rather than fact to make uninformed cuts.

review_title: Nice benefits, interesting work, training and progression lacking
job_title: Research Assistant in Belfast, Northern Ireland
pros:
Good pay and benefits.
Interesting work that you could sink your teeth into. 
Lovely campus to work at. 
Additional work opportunities (i.e. assisting in classes) depending on the department you're working with.
Some flexibility in working hours
Nice co-workers
cons:
Overworking/overtime depending on the work being completed and deadlines that have to be met.
Limited feedback, training and advancement opportunities

job_title: Research Associate in Jordanstown, Northern Ireland
pros:
- Flexible schedule, no day the same

cons: Office politics is one of the worst thing present in the workplace. labs are poorly maintained and safety instructions are poorly followed. One has to maintain a high degree of confidentiality about their project.
